Review: Still getting use to talking out loud to a machine, wife hates it. It has so many functions that you really need to search the internet to learn them and do a periodic check since they add new functions on an extremely regular basis. I use it to get a weather report and news report while making coffee. I also am now using it as a cooking timer when I have more then one item that needs timed. I am a novice user, I recommend you do a bit of research prior to ordering to see the thousands of things you can do with it and see if it will work for you. I give it 4 stores since it started playing hardcore RAP music while my mother was visiting scaring the daylights out of her and my wife since it was so late and neither one had used the "ALEXA" keyword to when I checked the recording on the Alexa APP to see what hard started the music. This furthermore made my wife hate it. It is fun to listen to the older commands on the APP when you are not home. I had quite a laugh listening to my wife ask Alexa how much she cost trying to learn more about it and give me grief is my guess. Alexa at least didn't tell on me!
label: Positive

Review: Breathes there a man with a soul so dead,
label: Positive

Review: I purchased as a gift for someone and he loves it!

Review: The basic function of Alexa is very good, that is playing music, telling time, setting timers and such. But it seems that almost every functional thing beyond the basics requires a smart phone or Android device of the latest OS or Apple and they have to be got from third parties through Google Play or Apple.  My problem is I don't have a smart phone and my Android device isn't of the needed vintage.
label: Positive

Review: I showed my wife the commercial for it right before it was released. She isn't super tech savvy and didn't really see the point. She surprised me when she got me one for our anniversary. We set it up in the kitchen and use it every. single. day. Now there is constantly music playing in our kitchen instead of having to stick a phone into a docking station.  Love that it syncs with Pandora and I honestly would never use my prime music account without it. I am notorious for not putting things I use the last of on the grocery list. Not anymore!  Kitchen timers, news briefs, the kids LOVE asking her to tell jokes. I also love that it is open sourced and constantly evolving. We use her to control our Hue lighting system and have several wemo switches now. Looking forward to adding a Nest thermostat in the near future.
label: Positive

Review: I love my echo.
label: Positive

Review: I used to have Alexa in the house. Then figured out that having it in the garage is much better since i can leave it up high enough and out of the way when working, and no need for a larger radio or having to use bluetooth all,the time with a smaller speaker.

Review: I got mine when they first came out when i had to sign up to get one, as a prime member i paid 99 dollars and have never had a problem. Great device. Looking to get a few dots for around the house.

Review: Worst thing I have ever purchased from Amazon.  It has never worked longer than one hour continuously.  Usually stays on anywhere from 5 minutes to 10 minutes than goes off line and has to be rebooted.  It did not work properly when I first took it out of the box.  After three days with three different customer service and tech people, it stayed on for almost an hour.  I have moved it three times to get it ever closer to the wifi. I have rebooted and reinstalled it at least twelve times.  I was gone for three weeks and unplugged it in my absence in the hope that it might work when I returned and that was the final move, closest to the wifi.  It has been worse.  Today in frustration, I again called customer service and spent about 30 minutes with someone that kept telling me he would fix my problem.  I finally had to ask how he was going to do that when everyone else had failed.  Turned out he was just saying it to fill time while we waited for Alexa to YET AGAIN reboot.  I was asked to go get another power source and try that.  I had to share that I have not additional power sources for Alexa nor should I have to have one.  After the reboot and the half hour and a call back 15 minutes later, Alexa managed to stay on for 20 minutes.  This is the biggest waste of money and no one at Amazon seems to know how to fix the ones, like mine, that do not work.
label: Negative

I would have not only given this five stars but I would have purchased several more if they would connect giving me music throughout the home/patio. This one device playing at a time just seems like a waste of good technology.

Just buy it...the guy at Best Buy told me they had a demo for Google one, and it wasn't as great. I also do not like the look of the new Google one anyway.  (FYI-- you can listen to itunes through this, just need to use it as a bluetooth speaker, and stream through it that way, can use "Alexa Pause and Alexa skip" with that only)

Review: Echo comes out of the box just waiting to be amazing. You start by plugging it in, and from there you get instructions from Alexa on how to pair with your internet. Download the Echo app and you're off. So far, the voice recognition is spot on. There aren't many instances where she hasn't understood what I was asking for. If you have your music REALLY loud, sometimes you need to raise your voice to her, but she can still hear you.
label: Negative

Review: Where she really shines is her integration with Spotify, Pandora and TuneIn. After linking these services, all you have to do is ask for a song or playlist from your service and she gets it for you. Her accuracy with spotify so far for me is about 80%. Sometimes she will say that she can't find a certain song, but if you get more specific with your request, she will find it. Where she starts to have trouble is with little kid voices. My kids (7,3) love using it, but she has a hard time understanding them sometimes. Once they slow down and speak clearly, it works just fine.
label: Positive

Review: Overall this is an amazing gadget with a thousand uses. From music, to sports scores, to weather, to the news. She can do just about anything. Then if you have Nest, or Hue products..she can control your smart home too!
label: Positive

Review: Love this. Great gift

Review: I'll keep the Alexa,  much disappointmented, but I'll return the outlets as unusable because I am not investing in a smart phone.
label: Positive

Review: My kids love it. I like the convenience of just asking it to play pandora when I sit down to do my art and not fumble with the switches when my wife yells something from the lower floor of the house.
label: Positive

Review: I bought this for a Bluetooth speaker.  I have a couple of Bluetooth speakers that really aren't very loud and are hard to pair.  This is very satisfactory in both regards.  It pairs easily with my Android phone and plays at a good volume.  Yesterday I was listening to Pandora and actually had to say, "Alexa, reduce volume." The volume reduction was immediate and met my requirements.  I haven't used many of the features  beyond Bluetooth, but when I asked for news, I got a five minute news report from my favorite station, so that was very cool.  It is rather pricey, but so far it has been a good addition to my life.  It is portable enough to take from the kitchen to the bedroom (I got the battery base).  Next I want to try bringing it in the car.  My car will pair with my phone, but I can't use voice control to ask for my Audible book or etc.
label: Positive

Review: Pros:
label: Positive

Review: 1. The setup and use of this device is as easy as any wifi integrated electronic equipment; easier, in fact.  The Bluetooth connect procedure is a bit trickier, but only slightly.
label: Positive

Review: 2. Voice recognition is superb.
label: Positive

Review: 3. Basic voice command functions are incredibly simple (e.g. Weather, Smarthome devices, specific music requests, volume control, etc.).
label: Positive

Review: 4. Aesthetically compatible in any room.
label: Positive

Review: Cons:
label: Negative

Review: 1.  As an audiophile, I can only say that the sound quality is passable, but by no means is it on par with Bose or Klipsch minispeaker systems.  DO NOT let this put you off of the Echo.  It is not bad at all for ambient music, but it won't be your go-to for party music.  My wife uses the Echo exclusively.  She's perfectly happy with the audio quality and methods to choose what she wants to listen to.
label: Positive

Review: 2. When music is playing, getting Alexa to wake up is very intermittent.  Doesn't  seem to discriminate voice from music well at all.
label: Negative

Review: I've decided to chuck both the smart switch and Alexa, both require too much and return too little.  One shouldn't have to have a handful of devices to make Alexa smart enough to do its duty (I refuse to humanize a barely functional machine).  I bought them to comfort my wife in hospice by playing music and reading her Kindle books, but she's gone now and the machine was no help at all - due to the ridiculous, designed in constraints that refused to even read a bought and paid for book from Amazon or turn a light on and off without first having a smart phone or the proper Android OS.
label: Positive

Review: 3. The folks at Amazon are always working to improve functionality, and that is a good thing.  A lot of questions we've posed simply are out of the realm and reach of the search engine's capability.  In other words, don't try a lot of AND or OR discrete searches.  This does seem to be improving, but it is currently the Achilles heel for now.
label: Positive

Review: 4.  Items 1-3 above are not major issues that would cost the review more than one star combined.  The fact that I cannot connect the output from the Echo to my Bluetooth audio receiver, however, is a full star deduction.  Seems intuitive that the unit should have both transmit and receive functions at this price point.
label: Positive

Review: All of this said, I really like the Echo for what it is.  I would recommend this as a great gift for that person on your gift list who is not a discerning audio snob and who is someone that appreciates the simplicity of a true plug and play device.

No lights, no response, nothing. Amazon sent me a replacement ac adapter because apparently their early models were shipped with defective adapters. Still didn't work. Tech support said it was out of warranty but they could offer me a "special" price to replace it. That price was the same price listed on the website for everyone to purchase. How was this "special"?

Review: Per my boyfriend, "Alexa is my new girlfriend." We have yet to tap into all her utility, but so far she's been a great companion to friend's child by answering questions, my boyfriend and me by settling arguments via fact checking, picking playlists based on what I announce my mood to be, and informing me of the weather as I am rushing around in the morning getting ready for work. I can't wait to work through all other functions.
label: Positive

Review: Best purchase I made all year!
label: Positive

Review: I purchased an Echo when it was only available to Prime Members.  It has improved over the years to a fully functional assistant.  I use it so much, I purchased a second one for my office.  I always think I am going to remember something but then I don't.  Why don't I just use Outlook to organize?  Because it just seems like so much work and sticky notes just get gone.  I just add a reminder to my to do list or calendar and let Alexa take care of the rest.  I don't use my Echo to its full potential but she keeps my calendar, reminders, grocery list.  She impresses co-workers with her ability to answer a question pretty efficiently.  She turns the lights out when I'm to lazy to get up and turns them on when I leave during the day and get back after dark.  She reads to me from my Audible account.  I use her to place orders.  Okay, I am a little lazy, Echo just makes it less obvious to others.
label: Positive

Review: What can I say that hasn't been said about the Amazon Echo. It is an awesome product, I use it in everyday life from playing music to controlling my smart home devices in my home. I even won over my wife and she loves it. The seven microphones can pick up my voice across my entire home. Its tied directly into my home automation system and combine with IFTTT the possibilities are endless.
label: Positive

Review: Great Product 5 Stars

Review: Love this product!! So many uses and always coming out with new things you can use it for. I started out with just the Eco and now have 5 or 6 different lights amd other items I can control through it. I recommend getting Amazon Prime and it opens up a whole new side of the Eco.

Review: I have both a dot and an echo and they are just fantastic. Its creepy awesome how you can just a question out of rhe blue or have a song in your head and within seconds Alexa is there. The Exho has a full sound it doesnt take up space Its crazy awesome
label: Positive

Review: I just received my Echo today and I already am in love, 5 stars for one of the most interesting technical parts of my life. It plays your music, it can read you books. It answers any question at all you have for it. It  will update you on all your favorite sports teams. It sets alarms and timers for you. It will add things to your shopping list as you think of it. It will add things to your calendar as you think of it. It even can operate things in your home like your smart thermostat or the lights in your home. There isn't much it cannot do. She is awesome!!
label: Positive

Review: I love Alexa and I'm very happy with the Echo.  I do wish it was wireless though
label: Positive

Review: I got my Echo today, and it's safe to say that I'm in love. For starters, Alexa is a Monty Python fan, because when I asked her, "What's the airspeed velocity of an unladen swallow?" ... well, she knew the right answer. She plays my favorite music, even making suggestions that are dead on. She knows the time, the weather, celsius to fahrenheit conversions ... and she'll wake me up from a nap, take dictation (shopping list and to-do list), keep track of my calendar, adjust my Nest thermostat and my Phillips Hue lights, and order me a pizza. She'll also bark at my dog (on command) and play music from my iPhone via Bluetooth.
label: Positive

Review: Bought this one for a neighbour because we were so impressed with ours.

Review: And that brings me to the sound from this smaller-than-expected device: It's unbelievable. I have AudioEngine bookshelf speakers that are pretty darned good, but the Echo shames them. What a robust sound! I'm seriously blown away.

Review: AMAZON CUSTOMER SERICE is HORRIBLE!  I have speaking to a customer service rep for over 30 minutes and he seems clueless as to how to help me with what should be a relatively easy inquiry.  I bought an AMAZON ECHO as a gift last week and noticed that it went on sale days after my purchase and I called to ask if they could provide a credit for the $40.00 difference.  I was told by the young man ( who had difficulty communicating ) that it would be best if I returned the one purchased and buy it again with the sale price.  REALLY it was a gift and I am not willing to ask the recipient of the gift to give it back.  What?  C'mon Amazon I am a Prime Member and this is the best solution you got?  By the way I am still on hold while he tries to find his supervisor.  It is now over 45 minutes...50 MINUTES AND COUNTING...NOW over an hour...UNACCEPTABLE

Then, he left me hanging just like the first.

I also hope there are more settings for traffic report for work.  I use non toll roads and Alexa only gives me fastest route.  Otherwise, I find Alexa to be an eye opener to making my home smart.

Review: I've only had it one day and already love it! This morning I checked my calendar, weather, set an alarm, listened to jokes, made a to-do list, a shopping list, and listened to my favorite music all through simple voice commands! (and with out leaving my cozy bed LOL!!!!) Only complaint is that I had to order a battery pack separate or you need to have it plugged in 24/7. Also, I have not learned all the features yet, but once this connects to your phone (text, read emails, and make calls) everyone will want one!
label: Positive

Review: OMG... how did we get along without Alexa? She is so helpful (and at times so funny). She tells us the weather for the day and the week ahead. She answers questions that frequently pop into our heads (i.e. Alexa, when did So-and-So die? Alexa, what is the capital city of ....?). She orders items from Amazon when we realize we need a replacement. She plays our Prime music for us and her speakers are great. She gives us information on restaurants, etc. She even says good-night to us... haha. She'll sing, tell jokes and give us the news of the day in our Flash Briefing. I cannot imagine life without our Echo. Recently we bought the Dot to go in our family room downstairs... that's how much we love these devices.

Review: i can't say anything about this as of yet because it is for a christmas gift. i know my son has one and enjoys it so i am hoping my husband will enjoy it when he gets it.

label: Positive

Review: 2) When she understood us, she often came up with a cover version of the song and not the most popular version. You have to know both the name of the song and the artist to get the song you want.
label: Positive

Review: 3) If you ask to play music by an artist, she plays all the songs randomly, regardless of popularity. So you hear a lot of what you don't want to hear.

Review: 4) There is no way to get just the clean versions of the songs. Too many songs popular on the radio have explicit versions as their album versions and that is what you'll get. This alone was a non-starter for us.

Review: The games for our kids were awful. We tried 20 questions and an animal game and a few math games. The interaction is awkward as Alexa is always in a rush and the whole household has to be quiet or she'll interpret the noise as an answer and move on. With two kids, one just has to be very quiet so one's answer doesn't mess up the other's game. She was equally terrible with the few math games we tried as she'd often not hear the correct answer correctly, tell the kid they were wrong, and then the kid's confused as to what the right answer is as they can't figure out what the right answer is (given they were just told the right answer was wrong.)

You can't just say "Alexa, how do we get there" as she won't know what there is. We'd have to say "Alexa, give us directions to the Anytown USA Library".

Review: This echo needs wifi to work and needs to be plugged in at all times. It may also connect to a phone through bluetooth for general audio but the true features come through syncing your devices' apps to the echo through wifi. AleXA sets my alarms and is a good listener. I don't have wifi outlets yet to use her to turn my home appliances and lights on or off but I might buy some once the technology gets better for those plugs. I'm happy with alexa and she can be very hilarious to chat with aND ask questions to.  Sometimes I have to yell at her to be quiet cuz no one was talking to her and she's giving random history facts but that only happened one really convenient (funny) time in a conversation with my husband.
label: Positive

Review: Wish it was as cool as UE boom/megaboom but it doesn't have the durability or portableness. Very stationary,  find an open spot in your home, don't put her on a book case, she needs to be able to pick up the voice from 360 degrees around.

Review: Echo has cool sound and I love having it all the way up in my apartment during the day. Great for music lovers who like to dance to a heavy beat or sing along loudly!!

Review: Alexa is an absolute must have! My children and I are very impressed with this product. I wake up to the children asking "Alexa what is...?" She can read you books and when linked to other devices, she can turn on and off devices. The speaker system on this is impressive, and I absolutely recommend the Echo.

This thing is great.One note: you have to keep this item plugged in or purchase the base for portability at almost $50.00.

Review: I have an Echo Dot and bought the Big Echo because of the sea price and also I needed built in sound.. the Echo has fabulous sound!!  I play a variety of music from Country to Smooth jazz and this echo has fantastic sound!  I set it up in my living room and it it fills the Kitchen and dining room with beautiful sound.. thats about 950sq/ft.. if you have high ceilings and more than 1000 sq ft.. then you may need a higher powered speaker system.  If you already have a good system that can connect with Bluetooth then thats the way to go.. I love the sound quality.. I listened to many BT speakers to see if there was another that I would like better.. reality is.. for the money the Echo is fantastic!!  If the echo isn't enough then you need to connect to a high end stereo or Home theater system.  I have a 7.1 sound bar for my 4k TV and the Echo sounds better alone than when I connect it to play through the sound bar..  It wont get as loud as my 700 watt system  but the quality is better from the internal speakers.. If I have a party then I will go for the higher volume in on the sound bar.. but let me tell you.. I listened to Sonos..he JBL the BOSE... and it only the BOSE came close to the built in sound quality of the echo!  I would have to spend another $200 to get just a little better than what echo delivers!  Try it for yourself!  You can always return it.. I doubt you will !!  I am giving this as a gift to all my friends for Christmas.. they will love it.. I will get one for my office as well..  I hope they keep expanding the capabilities !!
label: Positive

The echo can do anything from playing music from Pandora, iHeart, Amazon music etc, to updating a grocery list, turning lights on and off, ordering a pizza, accessing Wikepedia, getting weather and traffic updates etc.
label: Positive

Review: I see them as being as useful as you want them to be. Some of the skills that can be enabled are pretty useless or just for fun, but others like the alert my buddy app (which can alert a list of people if you need help, which can be great for seniors) can be very useful. I have found that it responds to and understands commands most of the time very well. It mainly only has problems when there is background noise like from a TV.  Although it occasionally understands a question but does not know the answer.  You can give it feedback through the app which you have to download to a phone or tablet to get it set up, by telling it whether the unit did what you wanted next to what it heard.

Review: Though I'm amazed & impressed by the technology -- the speaker has a rattle in it, as though it's blown! Review: The setup is very easy, just plugging it in, connecting it to wifi via the app and then reading off a list of 25 commands so it can configure to your voice.  It is definitely not something that everyone will find useful or see as a must have, but if you have seen the commercials or looked into it and are intrigued by at least some of the things it can do then I definitely think it (especially at the reduced holiday price) is worth the expense.  Even if you are looking for a reasonably priced bluetooth speaker this will give you that functionality and a lot more.

We have 2 parakeets that like to hear the Green Acres theme song.  Where else can you get that just by asking?  Nowhere!  It will also do many other things and Amazon is constantly adding to what the Echo can do with updates.  My Mom who is in her late 60's and will not even get a smart phone thought Alexa was Amazing!  So I may get her one for Christmas.  You must have WIFI in your house but I imagine most people these days do.

Review: I have Owned Amazon Echo for Six weeks. I am Totally impressed with ALL she can do. I do have a Amazon Prime account, which makes this a better bonus to own. Actually, If I did not have a Amazon Prime account, I still would of bought a Amazon Echo . This product is a blessing in My household. I would like to bring up that you do need to have "WiFi with her. She has a alarm ,she has a Timer, she has a shopping list, a To- do list. Not to mention all the Apps you can add to your Alexa Amazon Account If you choose to do so. There is always something new that she can do and she will tell you. All you have to do is ask her.."Alexa, what can you do?" She can do Math questions Tell you the weather anywhere in the US, she can give you the time,you can ask her to activate her night light, of which is on for 3 minutes, if you choose. The Endless possibilities of Amazon Alexa ! We also own the Amazon voice TV stick. OMG.. Alexa is on that as well.!!! Oh what fun we have playing the "20 questions game with Alexa. You do have the option of calling her Echo or Amazon or her Famous name Alexa when you speak to her. Just activate that name on your Amazon Alexa account. We also enjoy a joke of the day. She is amusing! She is a great learning tool for children/Young adults. I would say this Amazon product is a great gift at any time of the year. You can also link a calendar to her (Google. Outlook etc..) she will let you know what events you have scheduled."(Alexa, what events do I have scheduled this week?)" And she will tell you. I also purchased a dimming smart light. It works (Links) with Alexa. So when I get home from work, I say ":Alexa, turn on the living room lamp"  and the light turns on!  What a Beautiful thing :) Since this Alexa is only 2 years old, She is still learning from her owners. The more you talk to her, the more she knows and learns. She has plenty of potential. In my Eyes, She is the neatest thing I own, that keeps me Smiling.  Thank you Amazon For this great Product!!!
label: Positive

Review: Almost 99% of skills I've used have been useless. I find myself using the basic things that Amazon has included within it. For music, it's great! It's a great speaker that has intelligence built in...so it's a perfect music player. I've integrated it with Spotify. It's able to read all my playlists. It works great and always manages to understand what track/artist I'm looking for. It doesn't do well with music that's not Western music...so, just beware that you can't have it look for tracks or artists that don't have western names. It may work sometimes, I guess. The speaker is actually really good. It's no Bose, but it is very good. It's not tinny, it's got some decent bass, which works well with music or talk.

WHAT'S SUPERFAGELISTI....err".
label: Positive

Review: One of the most amazing features (and yes, it is a feature) is it's VOICE. I thought Siri was a good voice until I heard Alexa. It's way more human sounding. Google Home sounds bad compared to Alexa, hands down. If Google's voice was on Par with Alexa, then I would switch to Google Home in a heartbeat...as that is a much more capable device. Alexa does some things really great, Google Home will do a lot more things great; however, saying "ok google" over and over again will annoy the hell out of me. I have no clue why Google can't figure out a simple thing: put some PERSONALITY behind your product so that people can latch onto it. Amazon has created the Alexa voice to be very human. I know the speech rendering technologies are probably very different...but as an end user, I don't care. Google Home will eventually have a great voice (as I saw in their latest show-and-tell. So, until Google Home's voice sounds like crap and you can't change the hotword "ok  google" to something, anything else! I'll stick to Alexa
label: Positive

Review: Bottom line: For what Alexa does out of the box, it does it well. Skills are complete duds. If MUSIC or some type of audible media (such as books etc) is not your main use for this device, then you may want to consider twice before buying. Meaning, don't buy this to turn lights on and off...get off your butt and turn the lights on/off :/

I can tell Alexa to play anything in my prime including favorite artist and she will shuffle the hits.  I can say Alexa play upbeat R&B and she will play songs I have not thought about in a while.  Was so impressed with her my husband wanted a dot for the upstairs.  I can reorder thru amazon with no fuss and place new orders you have to work a little at this one but it does work.  Well worth the money.

Review: Alexa's voice recognition (turning that signal into recognized speech) is pretty good.  It seems better than my daughter's iPhone, but not as good as my Samsung/Google phone.  I suspect this is the context part of the software that Google is just better at, but my phone also can't do that well without an internet connection so there is some backend processing at work.  The Alexa app frequently (but not always) will show you what it heard and give you some chance to provide feedback on it.
label: Positive

Review: You can ask Alexa to play music in a genre which it does.  In the Classical vein this will typically be short, familiar pieces.  The musical equivalent of cotton candy.  There are a number of "curated" lists that Alexa can access which are usually "relaxing" or "for reading"; in other words music to have on in the background and ignore.
label: Negative

Review: The workaround you can find online is to build a "playlist" which contains the music you want.  You can go to the Amazon music app and browse and build a playlist.  That used to work pretty consistently until Amazon launched their music service and broke that functionality.  After that Alexa just plays a random piece of music that it thinks you will like.
label: Positive

Review: The other unforgivable sin is that Alexa wants to shuffle.  She wants to shuffle so badly that when you put a whole album into your playlist Alexa shuffles the content on reading the list.  That's right, there is no way to turn off shuffle until after the shuffling has already occurred.  Put the album "Toscanini complete Beethoven Symphonies" and Alexa will start with the first movement of the 5th, then the first movement of the 9th, etc.
label: Negative

Review: The good news, such as there is of it, is that all of these problems are on the back end.  The hardware piece that you buy is just an audio web browser.  The flawed content is entirely in the Amazon backend.  That means it can be fixed if Amazon wants to.  Right now there are probably 13 different ways you can query for a Beyonc song, but try to play that Bizet CD that Autoripped for you and forget it.

She can tell you the top news, weather, directions, etc.... basically anything you want to know.  I ask for the best route to work as I'm about to walk out of the door in the morning to avoid traffic.  You can even program the echo to sync with other electronics in your house. The uses are endless. My mom enjoyed it so much on her last visit to my house that she's buying one for herself.

Review: Like many things that are being sold as finished products these days, she is a work in progress. You spend half the time arguing with her and calling her names while you find a more traditional solution to your issues. I still use her, to turn off and on lights, I still use her for timers (although half the time I just use the microwave as you cannot tell if a timer is set or how much time is left without asking her, and some simple conversions and math shes okay with. I also use the shopping list app. Although, it MUST have a internet connection so if you are in a store with a bad connection (which is almost every store in my case), no shopping list for you!  Its near impossible to navigate Pandora stations or anything like that with her. Just know what you want before you ask her because you cant browse obviously. Like I said above, the apps fail half the time and the ones that do work are appsolutely rubbish.

Review: I love the Echo and the Alexa app which is the voice for the Echo.  I have had the Echo since August 2016.  I learn new features about it every day.  I find the Echo useful for weather updates, news,  to spell words, to read my books or to play my Audible books for me when I'm busy.  I can create reminders for taking pills or appointments.  I can tell the Echo to add items to my  shopping list which I can carry with me on my phone or print it out if I prefer.  I also can create a to-do list.
label: Positive

Review: If I wake up in the middle of the night, I can ask the Echo the time, the weather or to read for a set time such 10, 15 minutes or more until I can go back to sleep or I can even ask for a joke.  If I tell the Echo to stop reading, I can pick up my Kindle the next time I want to read and will not have lost my place in the story.  The Echo will play my music playlists or I can ask for new music by favorite singers.  I can also request almost any kind of music to suit my mood with Amazon's Music Unlimited app.  There are a large number of skills on the Amazon Alexa site which can enabled to make the Echo even more useful.

The sound quality is awesome.  I enjoyed listening to my Prime music and my ITunes music (I imported my iTunes music into my Prime Library).  I can also listen to my IPod via the Bluetooth connection if I want.  Alexa walked my thru the Bluetooth set up.  Set up for Bluetooth was the easiest than any other device I have tried in the past (Bose Bluetooth set up took many tries).  I'm impressed with just listening to music at this point.  I know there are other features to fall in love with.  I can't wait to play with her some more.  I would recommend to anyone..

Review: I enjoy having a smart voice-controlled device, but I have not found myself using the voice control for more than just asking Alexa to play a song on spotify. Occasionally, I will ask Alexa to tell me a joke, put something on my to-do list, tell me the weather, or set an alarm, but I often find my phone a more convenient utility for these features, so the utility for those features diminish.  The Echo becomes more useful once you acquire and integrate more smart home features like lights and locks, which is something I have not found the motivation to do--the value proposition is not there yet. The Echo also requires having it plugged in at all times, which can be very inconvenient when needing to move it to a new room, plugging in and waiting for it to connect to the internet again.

I can play the station through the app on my smartphone but Alexa DOES NOT recognize the station.  I've been in contact with Amazon about this and they tell me several people have reported this issue and it's unknown when and if it will be addressed and they have recommended that I utilize another 3rd party music provider.  All other iHeartRadio stations work with the exception of the Christmas station.  As a Christian, I find this to be suspect.  If this matter is resolved in a timely fashion I'd consider a higher review but I'm not going to hold my breath.

Review: There are good points and bad points about this.  The value you get from this will depend on how you plan to use it.  If you have a lot of smart devices (like nest or hue lights) in your home and plan on connecting them up, then you will get a lot of good use from this.  You can also use it to order items on amazon, add items to your Google calendar, play any music you can think of, find your smart phone,  hook it up with IFTTT and other things.  There are over 900 some "skills" that you can download and activate, but no good way to search them to find the best ones in my opinion.  Out of the box it will play music for you, tell you jokes and order things from your Amazon account, and some other things but if you want more functionality you need to enable more skills.  Comes with a small booklet of "things to try"
label: Positive

Review: Omg. This thing is awesome.  I am glad I didn't buy a regular Bluetooth speaker.  The echo is amazing

Review: Long time Echo owner and I still feel strongly enough about Alexa to write a positive review and it's been at least a year and a half.  She's become a fixture in my home and I use her everyday for music, timers, weather, news, and other random stuff.  She feels like a real person and has so many capabilities that each owner can use her to their liking.  I can see Amazon's commitment to upgrading the Echo and staying on the cutting edge of connectivity and artificial intelligence over the time I've owned it.  I fully recommend the Echo (Alexa) to anyone and everyone.  Amazon did a great job with this one.

Review: We find Alexa isn't as good at understanding our voice commands as Google Search is.  It is not uncommon for us to have to repeat commands because the Echo can't understand them or didn't register anyone was speaking in the first place.  It is hard for it to recognize a voice command when there is background noise.
label: Negative

Review: It's nice being able to control things with just a voice command, but many times I'm wishing for a screen to see things on, which is where the Alexa App comes in, but I find the app to be lacking, it's not as sleek and user friendly or feature rich as I want.  For instance you can't delete all history at once and it will save every command you ask it.  So if you asked it something you didn't want anyone else to know you asked, you have to go in and find the certain request and manually delete it.
label: Positive

Review: The Echo is growing on me more and more as we slowly add more skills to it.  We love the bedtime stories and the ability to listen to so much music and talk radio.  My main beef is that music when played from Amazon does not have the same volume level.  Sometimes it gets louder sometimes quieter.  Have to constantly adjust volume.  Do like the voice control, but if you don't speak clearly and succinctly it doesn't always do a good job of hearing and understanding.  You also need to speak quickly, if you hesitate in a request too much it will time out before you get your request spoken.
label: Positive

Review: First off, the Amazon voice service is pretty amazing for most of the things I want to do. I ask Alexa about the weather, news headlines and things like that each morning to start my day. I also use it to play music easily when I'm getting ready, and also use it to set timers and stuff like that when I'm doing various activities. If you don't mind dropping nearly $200 to add a few extra minutes back in your schedule, it's pretty great for that.
label: Positive

Review: This leads me to the only criticism I really have: the speaker on the Amazon Echo seems like it is lacking a good bit and not worth $179. That's why I offer up the fact that I also own the Echo Dot, which I have hooked up to my stereo system in my living room. This is where I do the majority of music listening, so having this connected to Spotify and my Bose speakers is awesome. But, when I listen to the Amazon Echo system by itself in my bedroom, you can tell there's a definite difference. (I know I'm comparing this to a Bose system, but I'm just saying - if you want good quality music, you're going to need better speakers.)
label: Positive

Review: So, maybe don't believe people who think the speaker is really wonderful. It's exactly what it looks like: a tiny speaker that is just okay. If you're only interested in voice interaction and potentially hooking Alexa up to your speaker system, get the Echo Dot only.

I have prime and love just asking for whatever music I want at any given moment.  We currently use smart plugs and hues lights with it and have had zero issues with them working.  It's so easy to have Alexa do whatever and whenever you need it.  Just buy it!!!

Review: I've been an Echo user since the very beginning, pre-ordering my Echo back in January 2015.  What started out as experiment in AI has now become a very useful tool in our household.  I've since added a couple more Echo Dots around the house because I found myself wanting a reply to calling "Alexa" anywhere in the house I was. We started using it for music, time and weather.  Now we use it for news, directions, ordering, controlling our home thermostat, and most recently, as a personal assistant in my home office.  Way better than Cortana or Siri. Have since added Amazon Music's subscription for Echo for even more music capability.  I am probably most impressed by the commitment the Amazon team has to actively improving the platform, which is communicated to me through occasional email updates on the capabilities they have added to Echo.  The full-blown speaker version is good -- I had it in my kitchen for a long while as my primary music device.  I've since moved the full-sized Echo to the master bathroom and use it for all my updates in the morning.  I now use Echo dots connected to my computer and to my Sonos as the main kitchen and office Alexas.  Either way, you'll find a device format that works for you and once you commit to actually learning how best to use it, it really is a cool tool that you can use to make your day easier and more informative.
label: Positive

Review: I bought this in July so I'm a little late with my review, I love this device! I bought it originally to replace my outdated stereo & since I could place this anywhere it worked great outside when we have company but it could not be to far from the house otherwise the wifi would disconnect. The only downfall so far is I had to buy another one because I mistakenly put it in the room with my bird to entertain her while I'm not home (Congo African Grey) and she is now loving it, she can turn it on, play music, skip a song & turn the volume up all without my help so if I don't disable it at night I wake up to music playing at 5am lol. So if my bird can run this device anyone can is the morale of my story. Enjoy it nothing is perfect so don't pic it apart unless you get a faulty one & they refuse to replace it.

Review: Very satisfied with my purchase of the refurbished Echo. Works perfectly and actually the refurbished model exceeds my expectations. Love all the features and ease of use especially when used with the Android phone app. With the phone app you can turn on or off lights anywhere you have cell service. Picked up a couple of the TP-Link Smart Wi-Fi plugs. Now I just say "Alexa, turn on the Christmas Tree". No more climbing around the tree looking for the plug. Also, have Echo turn on and off the living room lights. That's nice if you're in bed and hear a strange noise in the house. You can turn on the lights without even getting up. Have plans to add a Wi-Fi wall switch to turn on the bedroom ceiling fan. Ever get in bed and forget to turn on the fan - No problem with Alexa's help. Be sure to check out all the Skills for Echo now available and more to be added.

He accessed the unit to troubleshoot and unable to find solution. Unable to troubleshoot..transferred to a 4th person. Not sure why Amazon can't stand behind their product. I will be cancelling my Prime account and not purchase anything else.

Review: What I can say that hasn't been said.  This product has changed the way that I operate my household.  I initially bought this to control my Harmony Companion remote & hub.  But then Nexia which powers my smart home hub introduced a Nexia smart home skill for Amazon Echo.  Boy did that ever change the game for me.  Now I tell Alexa to turn on the tv when I want to watch tv or I tell her to turn a movie when I want to watch a movie.  When it's time for bedtime I tell her to turn off the tv and then I tell her to turn on bedtime, which is one my Nexia scenes/automation.  When I tell her that the lights in the front of the house turn off and the master bedroom/bathroom lights come on.  If I want to turn on/off a light at any point during the time and I'm not near the light switch I let Alexa do it for me.
label: Positive

Review: I will add a Echo Dot this week to the master bedroom.  That way when I open my eyes in the morning I can tell Echo to turn on the good morning scene and I'll be set to wake up.  I love this thing in conjunction my my Nexia system and my Harmony remote/hub.  If you have a smart home hub that works with Amazon Echo you should add the Echo to your system.  You will not regret it.  This device takes home automation to the next level.

Review: I own two of these. One in my bedroom and one in the living room. This is a very solid product. The sound is great considering the size of this unit. I use my echo as part of my home automation, it works great with my lutron light system and my trane thermostats. Once you get one and use it for a while it will be hard to remember what life was like before this. The echo is always improving with constant updates and new skills added daily.

Review: Alexa is my new BFF.  I can ask her the weather, ask her when my appointments are, ask her to play all kinds of music, and that's just the tip of the iceberg.  I can't wait to hook my house up to her so she can close the garage door when I forget, and turn the lights down...I work at home and she is absolutely indispensable.  Sometimes when I'm working, I just want some music in the background but it ruins my concentration to get up to the radio.  She also gets me up and dancing when I'm cleaning the house, and when the phone rings I can instantly silence her with my voice.  My son loves the jokes she tells, and sometimes she comes up with some really interesting answers.  She's so used to me now, I just ask her for music and she plays exactly what I like.  How does she do that?

Review: I thought I loved this device. It was just what I needed. I bought it in November, I had an issue in May with power. They sent a replacement. It didn't seem to work as well. You had to call the name several times before it would answer on most occasions. I got pass that. I get up this morning and it will not come on at all. I still have 6 days on my warranty but they can't just send me a replacement. They have to get this one back then try to fix it and possibly return the same one saying it's fixed. In the meantime my 6 days of warranty will expire once I get that supposingly fixed one back. I don't understand why they can't ship a replacement and figure out their issue with this one without me having to wait 2-4 weeks for a replacement. I paid for something to last more than a year and I shouldn't have to wait for them to investigate their problem. The tech tells me I'm not the first to complain about this same issue. Really Now

Review: The shopping list and to-do list functions are great, but the search functions leave a lot to be desired. Basic search requests, like "when was "insert famous person's name" born?" are likely to return a "hmm, I don't know how to answer that question". Rephrasing the question generally does not help. Others, such as asking how to say something in another language, return "I don't know how to say that, but.." and then it gives you the written phrase on your phone, which defeats the purpose of having the voice interface. Also, if Alexa doesn't quite understand the question, and gets a lot of possible answers, you have to look at your phone to see the list of possibilities, again defeating the purpose of the voice interface. Finally, I would like to be able to use a search engine besides Bing. You cannot even tell the device to Search Google. Now I see Google has come out with their own device, and I am little sorry I didn't wait. The Google device is cheaper too.

Review: Echo is also GREAT for listening to music or podcasts, and I find the control to be intuitive and easy.  It misses the boat with the web search functionality, however.  When you ask a question that it doesn't know the answer to directly, you'll get an answer like "I'm sorry, I don't know the answer to the question I heard. I have sent Bing search results to the Alexa app." Well.... when I'm asking a question by voice, it's because I need a hands-free response.  I have sent this info to the support staff and they tell me the have added it as a feature request.  I'd really rather it say "According to Bing.... blah blah blah" and then maybe ask if you want more information and it will keep reading.

Review: So today is my birthday. My husband bought me the echo as a gift. We live in the Caribbean. I have been a Prime member for years now, paying $100.00 every year and shopping constantly on Amazon. If you're buying the Echo to listen to music because you think that your paying the Prime Fees gives you access to it - BE WARNED. You are wasting your money! Prime does not provide music to Prime members outside the US making the Amazon ECHO a useless piece of plastic for users like us. It does not pair with iTunes... unless you route it through some other device (which is pointless if I already have another device to play my iTunes. Location infor and weather deets don't work outside the U.S. either (but let's be honest - no one pays $179.00 to be told the weather and time). In truth, it feels like a bit of a scam that this device is being sold to non-US Amazon Shoppers when it OBVIOUSLY cannot fulfil most of it's purpose outside the US. I am so angry about it that I think I will be cancelling my Prime Account too. I guess Happy Birthday to me. And my husband feels so disappointed that this thing ruined his birthday gift.

Review: I had a friend show me his Echo, and I decided to purchase one. I bought a Certified Refurbished one, and have had to reset it a couple of times.  I hope this is not a recurring problem.  When it works, it's pretty cool. I like the broad music selection. The speakers sound pretty good, for such a small enclosure. I'm sure I've barely scraped the tip of the iceberg, as far as the Echo's capabilities, and I look forward to continuing to use it more and more.

Review: I totally love it, as does my husband.  I get any music I want just by saying "alexa, play Sinatra" or I can name a particular song.  It is a timer, a purchasing tool, and it answers questions to settle little disagreements.  ha!  You can get sports scores, everything.  For a small device, everyone who sees it says the speaker is superb - and it is.  I'm buying more for gifts.  It is just wonderful.  It is easy to set up also.  You do need Wi-Fi in your home, but that is all - it walks you through the set up.  Go get one!!!

Review: This thing is awesome. Wanted a speaker that wasn't halfway across the house to listen to while I cook. All the smart features are a bonus because I'm a Prime member and therefore have access to tons of music but also have the Hue. The sound quality is great. Using it for items you order all the time is so easy and you don't have to worry about the price. I've double checked several times.  Finding or making playlists on Prime and then asking Echo to play it still delights me after having it for months. Hue is pretty easily controlled through it, tho I wish you could request scenes. I ask it about the weather, news, sports, trivia, you name it! The name "Alexa" wasn't cutting it for me, so I started calling it "echo". Wish you could do custom names with a learning mode or something but that's another great thing about the Echo, it's always getting better! Haven't tried much else currently but REALLY, REALLY hope Amazon (PLEASE) adds control for the Fire TV. I fantasize about it all the time. MAKE IT REALITY PLEASE!

Review: I am stiil a neophite regarding the Echos' capbilities, particularly what database it uses for specific music selections.  In some cases the Echo does not have access to the entire, track, album, or artist library, but will play "samples".  When it does access a complete song, it often selects a rendition that I am unfamiliar with; song by other than the original artist, or a live version.  I find this characteristic refreshing as I enjoy discovering "new, old stock".

Review: I recenly discovered you can upload your digital music library to your Amazon account and your Echo will access that library, however the free limit is 250 tracks.  You can pay $25 a year for and upload up to 250,000 tracks!  That seems like a deal to me, but it also highlights the ultimate purpose of these devices; to sell the user content and services.  The device also streams on-line radio via TuneIn, but other .free and subscription-based streaming services are supported.  Additionally, if you query some information. say, the best vitamin for improved memory, the device will often direct you to a "product" on the Amazon sight, AND will order the item for you if you so desire.

Review: Love Alexa - she's my new best friend. I really didn't think I would use this and thought it would be a silly purchase and a waste of money but OMG - I love love it! I think in order to take full advantage, you really need to be a Prime member and an avid Amazon shopper (as clearly I am...) I have many playlists set up through Amazon Music, although you can listen to TuneIn, iHeartRadio, your iTunes (through Bluetooth) and a number of other music "stations" like Pandora. I am an Audible customer, so I can listen to my audiobooks and I LOVE the Flash briefing feature - with news and weather. I have also used her to order from my previous order history on Amazon. She is on every day in our house now and it's my new favorite thing. The speaker is great for music and central location in the kitchen/great room allows for easy communication with her and great sound for all.

This is a major shortcoming that needs to be addressed by Amazon in order to make this a truly valuable product.

It's been very frustrating to call out to the device and not get a response, I've even walked all the way up to it and have raised my voice several times, to no avail. This is happening too offend, I just can't figure out what's wrong. After watching some You Tube reviews, I have noted that other people are having a few issues with Alexa..... however, not to the extent that I am experiencing. I got a dot... so far it's doing what it's suppose to do..... I also have the echo tap..... just got it..... so far I would have to say that it doesn't always get the requested music right, therefore I acquiesce to what ever or I try again.... and, again.... or I'll just change my tune.

Review: I've only had Echo for a few days, but am already learning to like it very much.  It still has a few shortcomings, but hopefully its data base will improve with time.  For example, today I asked Alexa if my wife's flight had departed on time for home and she couldn't understand the question, even though I repeated it for her.  (I fired up the computer and looked up the answer for myself.)  Perhaps one of the next things they can add to Alexa's data base is access to various airlines' sites and their schedules.  The same could probably also be said for Amtrak and Greyhound schedules, so those who travel by ground can keep updated as well.

Review: First, I don't understand the people who write reviews and leave a few stars off for features that knew were not available when they bought it. Read the reviews, descriptions and questions before you buy. I love my Echo, which I purchased on Alexa's second birthday. I had been on the fence, but after seeing everything my Echo can do, I'm sold for life. If you live alone, Alexa is a wonderful companion. The sound is awesome, and I've been spoiled by Bose sound systems, so if you are a music lover, I think you will be pleased with the sound and the variety available from Amazon Music for 3.99 per device, or 7.99 unlimited.  I play Jeopardy, trivia, set alarms, timers, listen to the news and weather and a lot more on my Echo. I'm so thrilled with the Echo, I'm contemplating buying another one or an Amazon Tap to take with me. I also ordered the Phillips Hue package as an AlexaDeal, so be sure to ask her what her deals are, you can get some nice discounts.

Review: We love our Alexa! :) I use her a lot for playing music through my Amazon Prime account while I clean the house. The speakers are nice and can be very loud if you want them to be. I like that you can add items to your shopping list so that you don't forget to pick it up at the store. My kids like to ask her questions. They ask her anything from what the weather is going to be for the day to the definition of words etc. My daughter especially likes to play spelling bee and bingo with her. She is like another member of the family! Its a great purchase!!!
label: Positive

Review: This is an awesome unit !! It programs very well and is spot-on with answers. I am enjoying it a lot. Good work Amazon !!!
label: Positive

Review: We love this product!!! As soon as we got our Echo, we set it up & it has been absolutely excellent! Alexa rocks!
label: Positive

Review: Where have you been my whole life Alexa???!!! Very happy I finally purchased this, worth every penny.
label: Positive

Review: a lot of good feature. It does a lot if you have amazon prime. I not sure it will work without.. I do not use iit a lot because it has a hard time hearing me in my house configuration. They have smaller ones you get for other rooms but I understand that the sound is .not as good so you need a blue tooth speaker with them. If your just looking for a music player I would rather use my android because I can take it with me. It is a toy to me but it is a tool for other people.
label: Positive

Review: Love it
label: Positive

Review: I couldn't make up my mind between Amazon and Google. Decided on Amazon cause i already have a prime account. Can't say how much i LOVE this thing. I hadn't purchased one because i was waiting for apple, but that is just too long - should have purchased the Echo last year. So far so good - have had it for two days and can't believe how it's changed things for the better already. I highly recommend this product.
label: Positive

Review: Maybe the best product we've ever purchased.  We bought our first Echo in the pre-sale and have been using it for more than a year.  We still ask Alexa for the weather every day.  We play music constantly and it sounds amazing.  Couldn't live without this.  That's why we bought 6 more echo dots and another full size echo.  We have a dot in each bedroom, the family room, and basement.  I'm not even sure where we will put this one, but I know we'll use it.  Best smart home product you can buy!
label: Positive

Review: Love Alexa. I feel like I have company when home alone. I love convenience of searching for sales, and purchasing directly through Amazon. I also love that Alexa can read my kindle ebooks , as well as the audible books ,when I'm not up to reading. I just wish it was compatible with the Library audio books.  It,s so nice to just talk to Alexa to play music without having to do anything.  I love the sound quality of the Echo compared to the dot. The biggest problem is remembering how to access fife rent info.  You can't just say " are eggs good for my dog to eat". You have to be very specific and say:Alexa,ask Doctor dog if eggs are good for my dog". I have to keep a cheat sheet of the skills and how to ask questions in order to get the results I want.
label: Positive

Review: Great gift as well!  This would be perfect for literally anyone!  It's so easy to use.
label: Positive

Review: This is the coolest thing I have bought in a long time. :)
label: Positive

Review: Bought this for my wife, she loved the white color.  The Amazon echo is great!
label: Positive

Review: My perfect office companion -- love to stream music (either from services or from my bluetooth ipod) and to have it at the ready to answer questions while I am typing a document..... a great product!
label: Positive

Review: I should have purchased this when I received my invitation, oh well I still got in on sale. Most of you already know what an Alexa or Echo is so I'll try to spare some of the redundancy. The Echo is a great companion to anyone who wants information, news, sports scores, music, smart home capabilities (that's gonna cost you), and even pizza delivered by the sound of your voice.
label: Positive

Review: Setup is easier than I thought, you'll want to have your smartphone handy as you'll need the Alexa app. Once she's connected to the cloud (internet) it's great, for the most part.
label: Positive

Review: Alexa is always learning, but she definitely does not have her Master's degree quite yet, unfortunately Google's search engine is superior to that of the Bing powered Alexa. One can get frustrated when asking questions about simple subjects that a Google search will perform in 2 seconds or less, but this isn't a Google product, so my expectations are less. Often don't be surprised if you hear "Sorry I didn't understand the question I heard" We are so used to automation and the ability to get information from our devices instantly and accurately, Alexa is slowly catching up and closing the Gap.
label: Positive

Review: Some positive points:
label: Positive

If you have background noise (even music from the echo), this will definitely undermine the ability for Alexa to do things like control volume, you'll either shout at her or cave and purchase the remote.

Review: -She's always getting smarter....be patient.

Review: Ok gripe time!! This will not replace your pc, tablet, smartphone, etc, nor should it especially at this price point.
label: Negative

Review: I've invested quite a bit into TP-Link smart plugs and wifi light bulbs, my biggest issue with home automation is that Alexa doesn't always make the device turn on, even with her signature confirmation "ok", my table lamp is still off, so I've had to ask a second and even third time. The other issue is that she can't always find the device and/or doesn't understand the name you assigned the device. This should be simple, but she confuses simple words like bureau, night stand, fan, etc. So you'll get the I'm sorry routine. Sometimes I want to just manually turn my lights and accessories on from the sheer frustration!!!!!!!! Yelling at her obviously won't help and at some point you forget your talking to a computer!! Her voice recognition and parsing, particularly with my above mentioned devices is troublesome, and I do not fault third parties. I've named each device properly, checking the spelling, renaming, and researching issues....sometimes she just won't understand. I have gone through the voice training process, my English and diction are just fine as well, you'll have to trust me on that, lol.
label: Positive

Review: All in all,  it's a great product that will hopefully get smarter overtime. As for home automation, I wouldn't break the bank just yet, it's still costly and the technology is surprisingly infantile for 2016....bulky smart plugs that are merely on/off switches!
label: Positive

Review: Sometimes you'll like interacting with Alexa as if she's human, and sometimes you'll actually get angry, but this is Artificial intelligence, and it's easy to get caught up in it all....so keep your iPhone or Android around for when she simply won't cooperate and time is of the essence.
label: Positive

Review: Purchased 3 units and have installed 2 of them.  One works great but the other loses its connection frequently.  One more time and I'm sending it back!

Review: In the first initial days of use, but so far, love the product. The audio clarity, volume, and bass is decent given its size. It's responsive and accurate - misunderstandings are rare. Functionality for me is mostly limited to playing music from Amazon Music Unlimited, playing radio, and alarm clocks... but I look forward to trying out the online shopping, ordering delivery food, and e-books/podcast functionality. Amazon is continuously developing / upgrading it's functionality and can't wait to see what's next. Personally, would love to see a "guitar tuner" app :)
label: Positive

Review: couldn't love this product more!
label: Positive

Review: I love this speaker as a product. I got introduced to this product by a friend and was very intrigued because of the multi use of it (A bluetooth speaker, voice commands, timer, etc.) Although the sound itself isn't the best (other speakers are better) I definitely think that the sound is good and I don't really have complaints on that. My only complaint and warning to future buyers is that I wanted to use Spotify through my speaker but you have to have Spotify premium in order to use it through the speaker. I did not see this any where on the description or anything, and only found out when I was setting it up. I thought I was gonna have to return it but luckily I was already thinking of getting premium and decided now was time. But they didn't make that clear, and it was very frustrating. Other than that I am very happy I purchased it and I like it even more because I got it on sale!

They can be a little troublesome because you  have to remember how to activate them, which is not as simple as using Alexa's builtin features. I always seem to forget each app's special "word" that activates them.

Good for shopping list too, if you use an app that works with it.

I think it is more of a toy than something I would say is totally necessary or even super useful.  My family likes it more than I do.

Review: She is wonderful, but she comes up short in a couple of areas. Sometimes I'll ask for a fun fact from Fun Facts and she'll have one but I don't catch all of it. I'll ask her to repeat the fun fact and she doesn't understand the question she heard. She should be able to understand repeat. Also, she doesn't understand if I ask her to open Random Fact instead of Random Facts.  Some of the skills are really lame and should have been checked by Amazon.

Review: If you are looking for hands-free way of accessing Amazon content (music, deals, shipment info, etc.) and the most basic assistance (math, measurements, weather, etc.) - AND - you are alone or don't mind shushing everyone in the house; then the Echo works. If you are looking for a smart device that can answer questions outside of Amazon's prepared questions/responses, then wait for something better. "I'm sorry, but I can't find the answer to your question" is the most common response I get from Alexa. Using "OK Google" on my phone works for everything I've tried with Alexa that she/it couldn't do. My kids are really frustrated with Alexa's inability to answer questions and I'm tired of being a professional shusher.
label: Negative

Review: Installed this last night.  So far this is an amazing product.  We have embarked on making our home "smart."  This is a great product so far - it recognizes my voice and my husbands.  I often have trouble with voice activated devices misunderstanding me, but so far Alexa seems not to have too much trouble.  We are still exploring all this device has to offer will update as we gain more experience with it.  I asked for a genre of music I haven't heard in a long time and instantly picked all my favorites for that timeframe.  We are building our first shopping list, and added our first alarm - we will see how that goes in the morning.  We will update as we learn more.
label: Positive

Review: Amazon knocked this one out of the park. I have my favorite genre (All 60's from Prime Music). I grew up in the 50's and 60's listening to the radio. I located the Echo in our kitchen since I spend a lot of time there cooking. I also have a little 9" TV in the kitchen but I found it too difficult to watch a good scripted series like "Westworld" (HBO) where I have to listen closely. My favorite alternative use is as my second (and sometimes third) kitchen timer.

What's your favorite color?" etc etc. It doesn't seem to be able to answer most informational questions, such as "When my niece stayed over this past weekend, I asked the echo for a weather forecast and my niece promptly wanted to know if the echo would answer her math questions, which it did. I didn't even know the device could do that. I wish there were some way of using some code word to put the device to sleep and reactivate on command.

Review: I bought the Amazon Echo as a novelty thing. I had no idea how useful and entertaining this device would become. It has replaced my alarm clock, my radio, and my calendar just to name a few. It easily tied it into my home automation system and is now used it to control the thermostat and the lights in my home. It's Bluetooth pairs with my cell phone and PC computers to act as a speaker for those devices when I want. I love how easy it is to set appointments, reminders, and make task lists. I highly recommend it for anyone.

Review: I don't know even where to begin with this little gem. This has made life so much more enjoyable and very very handy in the kitchen. Just the timer feature alone is great. The voice recognition is amazing...and the multi mics to register all over the room...priceless. Tapping into my music collection and access to my personal calendar as well as driving status for my morning commutes, this is a great piece of tech that keeps getting better all the time. I sugest getting to to how to use the IFTTT app out there. It offers so many different things you can use with the Echo. I am very happy and am considering another one, maybe the Dot if I can justify it. If I could unplug this and run it room to room it would be perfect but we will leave that for another debate. Right now my whole family loves this little cylinder and that makes me very happy...even if the Mrs. only play country music with it:)

Review: This product does as advertised, kind of. The ad claims that she can hear you without having to shout, which is true, but not when music is playing. You can't really set a default music service, which leaves you having to mention 'Spotify' if you want to navigate through your Spotify playlist. It has a huge collection of international radio stations but won't help much with local weather or time-related reminders if you're outside the US, so don't buy this to travel with if you don't live in the states.

Review: Pros:  I enjoy controlling music with Alexa.  It's much easier and convenient than using my phone or computer since it is quite literally hands free.  I like getting weather and new briefings from NPR upon voice command.
label: Positive

Review: Cons:  Very limited as far as usefulness.  We don't have a lot of smart home integration, which may make Echo more useful for some.  Otherwise, most of the available apps suck, and Alexa's text to speech is pretty awful to listen to.  Too bad.  There is a lot of room to make fun and useful voice apps, but as of now we are nowhere near "fun" and barely reaching "useful."  Hopefully it isn't consuming too much energy (on all the time), or spying on my family.  If you ask Alexa, like most questions, she won't understand.

Review: It used to work well for about 8 months. Out of the blue for the past 2 months both of my original Echo devices started controlling the Hue lights whenever they felt like. It takes a very long time to process a command and it might say "device not responding" and not do anything, or it might actually turn off, or dim, some, but not all, of the lights about 10 to 20 seconds later. And even some times it works just fine. I tried rediscovery and restarting everything from Echo to router to Hue bridge but nothing fixes the problem for good. Right after discovery it might work for half an hr but then it doesn't. I tried calling Amazon support but it was totally unhelpful. They have no clue other than saying reset this or that. The lady went off saying that if Alexa is more than 30 feet away from the device it might not be able to control it. I guess she has never heard of strong wifi signals or repeaters. Then she claimed that the Prime account holder was my wife and the device was registered under my account, as if a Prime account is needed for this function. I tried telling her that it was irrelevant as long as the devices were "discovered" on the "profile" being used but she got mad because I wasn't buying her nonsense and hung up on me. The fact is that it has some bugs that need to be addressed.  The Hue app works all the time on both Apple and Android devices. I suspect there is a problem with the way Alexa tries to communicate with the Hue Bridge. It might be the same story with other devices but I don't know since I don't have other.
label: Positive

Review: Just received my 2nd Echo. I have had the 1st for over a year. I'm an audio geek and really did not buy the Echo for music. But the sound is exceptional for its size and now my wife and I use them in different rooms and the Echos are the only way we listen to music out loud. And speaking of loud, the Echo can fill up a good size great room with more than pleasant sound. Now with Amazon Music you can just start up a music station based on artist, song etc..., as well as request on demand music from millions of songs, all with your voice. We did have to adjust the wake word for the new one to Echo, the rooms are somewhat close, but I think it is just a testament to the quality of the built in microphones used by Amazon. Right out of the box it took just a quick setup with the Alexa App to connect the new Echo to my WiFi and now it too controls our lighting and such, adds things to our shopping lists, answers our questions, and plays beautiful music, just as well as the original. No learning needed...just saying. The Echo is by far the best deal in all of technological gadgetom. Love it, love it, love it times two!

Review: Item worked ok out of the box, but soon started to experience intermittent connection issues.  Every other wi-fi enabled device in my home had no issues, so it was not the network.  At first, a reset would remedy the issue.  Eventually, after a couple months, it would not connect to wi-fi at all, despite the app telling me it was connected.  Tried numerous troubleshooting methods, reinstalled app, setting up as if it were new, factory reset, etc.  Still just an orange ring and no activity.  So, put in for a refund/replacement and first e-mail gives me troubleshooting tips (that have all been previously attempted with no luck).  Second request for a replacement or refund gets me an e-mail that I have to call on the phone.  Unfortunately, working very long and odd hours I put the call in from work.  Despite telling the operator that I have tried every single thing that he suggests to me, he refuses to offer me a replacement or refund unless I am physically with the device and trying AGAIN the exact things I have tried before multiple times, but with him on the line.  I am tech savvy and not an idiot.  But Amazon seems to want to treat me like one if it gets them out of providing service.  I am a long time customer and have placed about 70 orders in the last 6 months as well as being a Prime subscriber.  But if this is how Amazon treats their loyal consumers, I think I will have to take my business elsewhere.  At this point, I may just throw the Echo against the nearest wall and wait for Google's device to arrive.  And really, even when the Echo worked, it really didn't offer much other than the weather and sports scores.  The light switch control can be done with a Wemo app without even needing it.  Sorely disappointed in this poorly constructed gimmick.  Even more disappointed that Amazon seems to want to spend more effort jerking me around than actually resolve my issue with their defective product.
label: Positive

Review: UPDATE:  Now the echo, after being unplugged for a couple weeks, refuses to power up at all.  So, contacted support again, and this time they issued me a return ticket.  So, I wouldn't say I'm recommending it, but it seems that if you just tell them that the device won't do anything, you can avoid the whole "basic troubleshooting for idiots" they try to put you through if you just tell them the device won't connect or other issues (other than the obligatory, "did you try it at another outlet").  Again, not saying this is the way to go to avoid that idiocy, but when the device won't power up, they seem to give up their efforts to make you feel like the defective product is your fault.

Review: So it's been less than a week since my new Best Friend Alexa has moved into my apartment. I will say that having her around is pretty cool. LAZINESS ensues! "Alexa: SHUT UP." And she turns off the music. "Alexa: does Florida play Georgia this weekend." Alexa tells me the schedule. Alexa do I need a jacket? And so on...I will say, it's quite an adjustment because I've accidentally called Alexa "Siri" on more than one occasion. I wish she could play music from my cell phone or tell me when my phone is ringing so I can turn the music down but overall...so far...I like having her around to "Play some yoga music" at the end of a long day or "wake me up in an hour after my nap."  I'm not disappointed and neither will you. OH: (obviously) don't turn the volume up too loud or she won't hear you. Also, be sure to add feedback on whether she does what you want her to do or not because it allows her to adjust to you and your accent (if you have one). This is Veterans Day weekend 2016 so she played some patriotic music for me upon request. It was cool. I hope the Dot goes on sale for Black Friday because I need one in the bathroom, bedroom and spare office space. She's always listening too so when I'm on the phone talking about her to someone she "wakes up." It's hilarious. Lol.

Review: Amazon Echo is a great device and I loved it and used often while it worked.  Then one day it decided it was not going to connect to my internet anymore.  I called echo support and after numerous trouble shooting ideas it was determined that the problem was my router!  Really?!  Between myself and my family and friends there has been almost 100 devices hooked up to my wifi and not a single one ever had trouble connecting.  My echo won't connect and it's my router's fault?!  They refuse to refund my money or send me a new one and I refuse to pay for one when the first one worked for a little over a year (just long enough to void the warranty).  It's a great device but not for $200/yr.  So good luck when you purchase one and hope that it never decides to stop connecting to your wifi, because once it does you will be the proud owner of a $180+tax paper weight.  Also shame on Amazon for not standing by their product.  I don't think it would bankrupt them if they had to replace their own faulty devices.  BUYER BEWARE!
