Review: An amazing help around the house. That's the best way to describe it. Alexa has managed to help me organize lists both shopping and to-do lists so as to keep me on track which my main problem is always forgetting to do things. With each new skill she learns, the more she grows into my life. Need an order placed? Just ask Alexa. Pizza? Just ask Alexa. Have the lights dimmed or turned off? Ask Alexa. At first the idea of a smart home made me think that it would just make me lazy. Instead she made my life easier. I highly recommend also getting other smart home features like the NEST temperature controller, the Smart Lock system, the Smart Light bulbs. Connect your Smart TV and entertainment center directly to her and movies are now one simple request away. I have become a full believer in having a Smart Home now because of the Echo.
label: Positive

Review: I love Echo because I love tech toys.  I'm frustrated by Echo because it's not as intuitive as I thought it would be.  No matter what negatives I show below, though, I am so glad I bought it and would do it again.
label: Positive

Review: Before you buy, click on the words "Jump to:  Key Features." I didn't do this. My bad (I was caught up in the hype of advertisements as well as friends loving Echo). When you get to this key features page, skip the pictures -- they get in the way and take up too much room -- and read what Echo can do, including clicking on yet another link called Discover and Enable Skills. I was unaware of "skills."  What are they?  They are the what a user has to teach Echo because Echo doesn't know much on its own.
label: Positive

Review: Negatives:
label: Negative

Review: Answering questions, reading audio books, the news, weather, etc.:  Again it does these "skills," but because Echo isn't as intuitive as one is led to believe, some of them require teaching Echo the skill. For instance, it doesn't come able to give you traffic reports. From what I've been able to discern, the info given on the traffic report is only for the destination that's been programmed.  When I ask for a traffic report, it gives me the fastest route to New Rochelle, NY, which I programmed yesterday, and it's not a detailed report.  When I ask for a traffic report for Albany, NY, near where I live, it gives me the fastest route to New Rochelle, NY, again because that's what's programmed. I assumed, again my bad/ignorance, that Echo could/would give info such as "In Albany, traffic on Interstate 90 is heavy," or whatever.  Am I doing something wrong?
label: Positive

Review: The "skills" have to be downloaded and programmed via the Alexa app on a cell phone.  Not that big of a deal, but if you're a person who's uneasy playing with tech toys, it could be a problem.
label: Positive

Review: Playing music:  Amazon Music isn't free unless one is a Prime Member.  Pandora requires an account, which is to be expected, but is free.  I haven't tried the other services.  My Music Library is frustrating to use.  Songs appear that I haven't played or uploaded, and I can't figure out how to delete what I don't want.
label: Positive

Review: Skills:  There are hundreds.... thousands?  Most of what I've looked at, and I haven't looked at all of them, don't appeal to me.  For instance, the Good Housekeeping skill offers steps to remove common stains.  I need this info in writing because I can't remember detailed instructions. Nonetheless, it has almost 5 stars.  I suggest looking at the skills page before purchasing so you know what to expect.
label: Positive

Review: History: Everything you say to Alexa is kept in the cloud and also on the phone app. Everything!  Amazon says the info is used to make the Echo experience better, but it bothers me.  The good news is that the history can be deleted in its entirety from the Amazon site and piece-by-piece from the phone app.

Review: The good things about Echo:

Review: I love having all the music at my voice command.  I love being able to listen to radio stations around the world or my favorite NPR station nearby. I love telling Alexa (whom I call Echo), "Play gentle Christmas music," and she does!  I love telling Echo to play the Beatle's White Album, and she does!  It's easy to control the volume, either by talking to Echo or using the Alexa phone app.  The sound coming from this small item is great, and it sounds good whether on a low volume for background music or a loud volume so it can be heard a couple of rooms away.

Review: At first, I thought this was a frivolous purchase. But it is so much more than that. I take a ton of pills each day. I get involved with other things and I forget to take them. It's comforting to be able to chat with Alexa, to play games, stay in touch with the outside world. And the speakers are excellent. I find myself playing music much more frequently than pre-Alexa. The Echo went quickly from frivolous to essential.

Review: Excellent and interactive step into the march to artificial intelligence. Surprisingly fast response to questions posed and a real office and home assistance too.  It's definitely a needed accoutrement to every household and office environment.  If I have a complaint it is simply in the low fidelity sound which makes music listening muddy.  In all other respects the Alexa voice recognition is superb and the fact that "she" learns and keeps adding more and more information is quite remarkable. As a senior citizen, I find this device a necessary part of my daily routines and urge people considering a purchase to own Echo and at least some room extensions as well.  Well Done Amazon!

Review: The Echo with Alexa has made listening to my Kindle Unlimited books with audio and my audiobooks from Audible a pleasure! Before Alexa the best way to listen to Kindle Unlimited books with audio was through the Audible App (downloading books on the Audible App creates a much smaller file than downloading to the Kindle App and the Audible App has more features like a sleep timer and smooth narration at 1.25 x speed). Alexa improves on the Audible App by letting you activate the sleep timer without lifting your head from the pillow.
label: Positive

Review: TIP: In order to hear the professional narration that comes with your Kindle Unlimited books with audio you must say, "Alexa read 'name of book' from Audible". If you just say, "Alexa read 'name of book'" she will read it to you through text recognition. While a book is playing you can say things like, "Alexa pause" or "Alexa resume" or "Alexa go back 30 seconds" or "Alexa set sleep timer for 30 minutes."

Review: I have had the echo since the original beta offer. I wanted to wait quite some time to really put it through its paces and wait for it to become fully featured and to get some home integration items. Now we have 2 Echos (kitchen & bedroom) and a dot (media room). Connectivity wise, we have a Phillips Hue bridge, 6 Hue lights, and a TP-Link Smart Plug. Things I love about the Echo:
label: Positive

Review: 1. Flash briefing -The customization of news is awesome. My GF and I are both in technology, so we have weather,Echo tips, tech news, and world news on our briefing.
label: Positive

Review: 2. Home Automation - I rarely use light switches anymore. If you want to feel like you are in the future, get some smart lights and integrate them to Alexa. Being able turn lights on/off, and dim them is awesome. In addition to what Alexa can do, the lights flash if we get texts or calls, so we can silence our phones and still be aware of incoming messages or calls if our phones are not on us.
label: Positive

Review: 3. Music - I love music, and I always have to have it on wherever I go. Short of an intercom/music system, our Echos are perfect. Music is one of those things that I always found to be painful. Before I would have a BT speaker which I'd have to pair to my phone then open an app (Amazon Music/Pandora) to get music. Now I just tell Alexa to play a playlist/music/pandora, and I'm done. The Echo really is perfect as a music vehicle, and if I need to exert more control I can use the app.
label: Positive

Review: Then the third-party skills (Amazon's word for "apps"). Ugh. Frustrating that skills are a pain to enable (you can't do it by voice), and that the "skills marketplace" is filled with half-baked dreck. Some quality control and real developers could go a long way toward improving that. The search is bad. The skills are mostly bad ideas. Then you find one that's a good idea, and there aren't enough reviews to tell if it's any good or not. The only one I've found that I didn't promptly forget is the "Where in the World?" geography trivia quiz skill, and even that's not perfect.
label: Positive

Review: 4. Skills - Skills still seem novel, but the flexibility of skills is impressive. My GF is a developer and tried her hand at a basic skill as part of Amazon's promotion. She seemed impressed with what could be done.
label: Positive

Review: I remember when I first got the Echo it was mainly a tool for an inquisitive mind. I wanted to push the Echo to see what it could and couldn't answer, but it has quickly cemented its place as a central piece of our house. Also, we've decided to make the Echo more seasonal. I wouldn't recommend it for the acoustics, but it is hilarious.
label: Positive

Review: I really enjoy Alexa.  She has such a nice, gentle voice and is responsive to whatever I ask of her, from playing music from the Amazon cloud to providing useful information from her vast library of knowledge.  She even responds to my telling her good night by telling me to sleep tight.  She gives me the news headlines from NPR, tells me what the weather is like, and lets me know what's on my calendar for today, tomorrow, or next week.  I often use her bluetooth access to play music from AccuRadio or Pandora.

Review: This product has proven to be unbelievably disappointing. At first, the Echo was interesting and a useful home tool. However, after the first few weeks, my wife and I found ourselves really wondering what use their could be for Alexa, besides creating lists, listening to the radio/news, and playing the occasional game of Jeopardy (all things that could be easily done on a smart phone or a computer, but were still cool to do on this new toy). So, that was when we really began diving into trying out the skills that the Alexa app had to offer, but most of them still leave something to be desired.
label: Positive

Review: Fast forward to the last month or so, and we have found that even interacting with our Echo is becoming a burden. For most questions that we ask, Alexa is unable to come up with an answer, and half of the time it is as though the system completely misunderstood what has been asked of it.
label: Negative

Review: Finally, it's frustrating that Alexa can't just search things. We are an Amazon household in almost every way, but if Google's home device can do web searches and the reviews are strong, I would consider making the leap. For now I'm pretty happy though!
label: Positive

Review: We have also recently noticed a substantially more frequent issue with the Echo waking when the wake word has not been used than we ever had at the beginning (in the learning phase). Add to that the fact that usage of the wake word is becoming less likely to actually initiate the Echo to wake with each passing day, and it is almost unbearable to have Alexa plugged in at all. In fact, when we updated the password for our home's internet access, not too long ago, it was literally days before we bothered to update the Alexa app with this new information. In fact, if it had not been for the convenience of being able to use her as a kitchen timer in that moment, our Echo would probably still be sitting idly by, disconnected from the rest of our household technology.
label: Negative

Review: If I had known months ago, when I purchased my Echo, what I know now, I never would have made this purchase. It has been nothing but a hassle, an annoyance, and complete waste of money. Most of the Echo's usable functions are more easily used with your smart phone anyway. For our home at least, Alexa serves as not much more than a speaker for music and the occasional egg timer. Very, very disappointing. We should have bought the Google Home.

Review: What did I ever do before Alexa? She is my new BFF. I doubt I have discovered everything she can do, but I absolutely love that I can just speak and have her play music for me. That is great when I am cleaning house, cooking or in bed. I can have her add items to my shopping list as soon as I think of them, so no more forgetting things I need. We play games together, she can tell me what the temperature is, how to get stains out of clothing, what time a show comes on and so much more. She doesn't always understand what I say or hear me as well as advertised, but I still like her. Also, if an Amazon Echo commercial comes on TV, be prepared for her to listen when her name is said. That also happened with another commercial that had a child named Alexa. The dad said the name a few times, making my Echo keep trying to respond. It was funny. The only downside is that my teenage daughter wants to use Alexa all of the time. She calls Alexa my robot. Too bad she can't vacuum the floor. Since we love her so much, I have also purchased Alexa's little sister, Dot, for my daughter. It's to be a Christmas present so sssshhhhh!! It will be our little secret. Make yourself or someone else happy. Buy an Echo...or two.
label: Positive

You can not ask Alexa can you give me direction to let say LAX or to the corner of X and Y in the City of Z. Would not work. Very very disappointing.

Review: Okay so this smart home speaker is undeniably futuristic. It's practical and accessible and the product is as described. I connected my Echo via its app to the major audio streaming services, including Spotify, Pandora, iHeartRadio, and Amazon's Prime Music. Once it's connected, you can tell the Echo things like "Alexa, play the Beyonce on Pandora." You can also pair your phone or tablet with the Echo over Bluetooth and use it as a wireless speaker. Once you have paired it, you can connect/disconnect it by telling Alexa to do so. So far I have been so in love and impressed with what the speaker has been able to do- totally worth it!
label: Positive

Review: A little disappointed in the things it can do. I thought it would search the internet for any question you throw at it. It's extremely limited in the information it knows. You just have to ask and hope you get lucky. The main things you can ask are team scores and a little info on when they play next game.
label: Positive

Review: You can't ask for a recipe, or why Cam Newton was penalized for start of the game, or phone numbers to stores, etc. It's very limited to what it knows. Basically it does math, it can spell, knows some basic sports info, plays songs from Prime Library, has timers and alarms but if sound is low when listening to music, you won't hear the quiet alarm. You really need to crank up the sound in order for the alarm to wake you.

I really don't have the need for it to keep myself. I told her I'd get her a outlet switch so she can use Alexa to turn on/off her lamp. Maybe that might be helpful for her....guess we'll see. I'm getting her one to try for Christmas.

Review: The voice recognition software is great. Like any of these products, having a fan in the background can distort your voice and make it hard for Alexa to understand. I had to repeat commands a few times, but only when the fan was on. For everything else, it was completely accurate.

Review: It has a lot of very functional uses. You can add things to your shopping list and to-do list, ask it anything you would ask google (facts, weather, sports, etc), ask the time, set alarms/timers, play music and control volume. I have used all of those functions and they work well. The alarm sound is perfect. I was worried it would be a loud and jarring sound, but it wasn't.
label: Positive

Review: The main reason I wanted to buy the echo is Alexa herself. I wanted to see if she really was a step up from Siri or Cortana. And I am very pleased! She is more than just a functional program, she has a funny and nice personality with answers for a lot of random questions/commands. My favorites so far are "Alexa, tell me a story" and "Alexa, do you have children?"
label: Positive

Review: I was so impressed with the speaker performance of the Echo that I'm trying Amazon Music. It just sounds fantastic. So far I have been able to find all except 2 songs I requested (out of about 20). 1 was a live performance so that's understandable, and the other was by a lesser-known band. Overall I'm very happy with the music selection. The volume controls are great, so convenient. And I have to say again, the audio quality is AMAZING. I was not holding my breath, because the echo is so small. So I was very pleasantly surprised.

Review: Skills are hit-or-miss. They are very easy to install, you just click "enable" and wait a few seconds. Most of them are great and work as described, but for some of them the voice commands don't work or the answers are jumbled (especially if it's reading from a live feed). Some of my favorites are chat bot (hilarious insults & really sweet compliments) and Motivate Me Please.

Review: Nothing is perfect though, here are the downsides of Echo:
label: Negative

Review: This device will record every single command that you use. You can view your history in Echo settings and listen to your voice. It creeped me out at the first time I found it, because I missed this aspect of the product when I was doing my research. I guess it makes sense though, that is how Alexa "learns" to recognize your voice more accurately. And on the bright side, you can delete anything you want and there is also a way to disable this feature altogether if it bothers you.
label: Negative

Review: Also, there are many questions where Alexa answers "I don't have an opinion on that". But to be fair, I was trying to throw really random questions at it. It does have a lot of really great answers too.

Review: I love the Echo but there are some downsides.  The inability to select a name of your own choosing is annoying especially when you leave the default name of Alexa on it and then a commercial comes on for the Echo.  I have had her start playing music based on what the commercial was asking for.  I have two homes and have an Echo at both homes.  They are both tied to the same Amazon account which is fine but there is no way to differentiate them in the Alexa app so you can have different settings based on what's in the home.  For example when I ask for my travel time at one house it tells me the travel to the airport as I have set up in the app.  However when I am at the other house and I ask her the same question she gives me travel time from that house which is over 1500 miles away to the same airport and not the local airport there.  I also have Phillip Hue lighting in both houses.  The list of my light bulbs and rooms are always on the app for both homes so I can't have office as a room in both houses.  I have to have office in one house and then make up a code word for the office in the other house.  I can only hope that as time moves forward that the programmers take a step back and enhance what is already there to make it better instead of constantly adding new content without addressing concerns over the current issues.

The one complaint I have is that with some song names (i.e. Dragon Slayer and Road Trip by NSP and various other songs in my library), Echo won't play the song and will instead redirect you to some other song, album, or artist. It's quite annoying, but not the end of the world. You CAN go into your amazon music library through the alexa app and play any song from there, but that kind of defeats the purpose of the whole voice operating thing. Anyways, if you're going to utilize ALL of the features of Echo and not just music, I say it's an overall fantastic buy!

I haven't set up music lists or such yet but I know they are available.  For now, I just ask for specific songs. Review: The sound quality when playing music is excellent, especially when compared to the Google Home - which I did side-by-side. The microphone also has good range; it can hear a command from another room or floor of my house. My only complaint is that the set up was a little more difficult than expected (I had to contact customer service as the included directions were not clear) and it cannot answer questions like Google Home can. Once the number of available apps increases and the device has access to a good search engine, I will rate it a 5-star. I would also like to see Amazon include a 1 year membership in Amazon Music with the device, rather than a 30 day membership. The cost to Amazon would be minimal but the advantage over the Google Home would be tremendous.

I was a little over zealous and didn't initially read the instructions so delayed my set up but once read, it was pretty straight forward.  YOU DO NEED INTERNET to use any on the ALEXA products (Echo, Dot or Tap) so if you are purchasing this as a gift, make sure the recipient has it.

Review: I have been in the home Automation Industry for 30 years and get to play with ultra cool things all day long so it takes a lot to get me excited about most products as so many disappoint. I have to say I was a little skeptical about this unit when I purchased it as I have dealt with Siri for years and absolutely hate her as she rarely works so my expectation levels for anything with voice commands was going to be low. Well I tell you that is not the case with the Echo unit as it works unbelievably great as far as voice recognition goes and the abilities to do simple things like getting the weather and the news or turning on a internet radio station is a breeze. I would say that Alexa ( The devices name )  works to do the task you ask about 85-90 percent of the time whereas Siri does maybe 25 percent at best, in addition Alexa is just a better name as well:) . I operate a Home Automation company and I can see us putting these to great use in our clients homes to control all the devices in their homes by voice as well as remotes or iOS devices.
label: Positive

Review: I thought about getting one for ages but wasn't convinced.  But, after talking to a friend who has one and finding a great deal on the Echo through QVC, I bought it.  I love it.  I always have trouble getting things up and running but this was so simple I didn't any difficulty syncing things up and was listening to music in no time.  Alexa is totally incorporated into my life.  She keeps my to do list for me,  She adds my shopping list to my iPhone.  She reads my audible books to me and wakes me up in the morning. She's funny too.  Today I said "Alexa how is your day going". She replied. "My day is going just fine". And she added something about how nice it was to have me around". Another time I had turned her off and all of a sudden she started talking as if she was.interacting with someone.  I asked her what she was doing and she said she was updating some things and learning new things.  No, I'm not crazy.  My husband heard our conversation and he said she was kind of amazing.  I got him the dot and he's just getting started with it but is amazed.  Get one or more.  You'll love her!
label: Positive

Review: We love our echo!!! We have now purchased 5 echo's for our family members. Everyone that see'S how many things you can do with this becomes jealous and wants one for themselves. I would say we use it the most for turning on and off lights every morning and evening or when leaving the house with hands so full it's a talent, and also all the music! Just ask her to play a song that's stuck in your head and she will do it!! You can repeat, pause, skip.. you can ask her questions, what the temperature is outside or when your favorite basketball team is playing next so

I WOULD love the Echo if Alexa could answer more of my questions. It's really limited. Like REALLY LIMITED. Wanna know what Die Hard is rated? Alexa doesn't know. Google on my phone tells me immediately. What movies are playing at my local theater? Alexa doesn't know. Google does... But if you ask her if she prefers cats or dogs she can let you know "she likes Toitles" (turtles with a funny accent). While cute... I'd like more answers to my questions. I'm considering giving it away as a gift and getting a Google home just for the better responses. I'm getting sick of asking her things that seem easy for her to still not be able to get it. I just go find my phone and ask Google. Upgrade this, Amazon! You can do it!

Review: One day I played TuneIn Radio and all of the sudden Alexa stopped working, no music was coming out of the Echo.  I didn't think much of it until I went to sleep and around 2 am Alexa turned the TuneIn Radio back on like nothing happen.  Scarred me so much that I had to grab a golf club and go downstairs.  First, I thought I had ghosts so I grabbed my phone and called Ghost Busters.  After a quick prayer, I started yelling at Alexa and told her that she scared me but she didn't understand that so I told her to stop playing music.  I had enough, our relationship was over at that point.  I told her I am returning her but she didn't understand me again (sounds like me ex).

Review: This is the coolest thing ever!  Even if it cost $500, it would be worth it.  It does everything you can think of, and if you look into it a little, you'll find that it can do a whole lot of things you can't even think of.  Looking at a cell phone or computer screen is the old way.  Now you just say, "Alexa, Weather."  It gives you the rundown on the weather.  Hear a new word and want a definition, ask Alexa what it means.  I hear this device can read a book to you.  Want news headlines?  Just ask.  It's a great speaker that you can use over Bluetooth.  I tell it a radio station using the iHeart Radio skill, and it starts playing my favorite shows.  Want to buy something, there is a way to order by voice using this device.  Or you can turn off that feature if you don't want to use it to buy things, then there are no accidents.  It has very sensitive microphones that can hear you over things already playing.  It's very intelligent.  I thought Siri was cool, but this thing is leaps and bounds better.  This takes a personal assistant to a whole other level.  I could go on and on, but just buy one and see for yourself.

Review: I have had the Echo for 2 yrs or so and have seen it mature into a really nice platform. I am a google fanboy, so when Google Home came out and I was able to get a really nice deal, I bought it.  So, the below is based on using both products.
label: Positive

Review: From a review perspective, if you are looking for a mature product with lots of integrations/recipes to smart devices you use today, then Amazon Echo/Dot is a clear winner and you will not be happy with the relative immature nature of Google Home. I am shocked that Google didn't spend the money upfront to have significantly more recipes/integrations prior to releasing this product to effectively complete against Echo. The big feature you hear about on reviews is Google Home's ability to carry context from one question to next.  For me, If I am going to do some multi-question thing, I am not going to talk to my device, I'm just going to grab my phone or tablet, which renders this feature relatively useless to me.  The only cool feature I like is Home's ability to to cast to Chomecast audio.  It is really nice.  I hope Amazon figures out a way for me to link all my Dots and Echo together, so I can "cast" to Dots. So before you buy anything, make sure it integrates with the services you have today. The promise from Google of future integration is nice, however, knowing google's track record of sunsetting products, don't hold out too much hope for the long term.
label: Positive

Review: Here are things where there is room for improvement:
label: Positive

Review: 1) With the Harmony integration, I would like to be able to have more granular control.  Presently, I cannot tell Alexa to change the volume of my A/V receiver, or channel up, channel down, bring up program guide, return to previous channel, record a program, etc.  The functionality is limited.
label: Positive

Review: 2) It is not integrated with the Amazon Fire TV.  This seems like a bit of a no-brainer to me as both devices are manufactured and sold by Amazon, and they are both sitting on the same local network.  Alexa should be able to tell the Fire TV to play some country music, for example, and have it play from the Amazon Prime music collection.  With a thousand watts of awesomeness in my home theater connected to the Fire TV, you think I really want to hear music from the Amazon Echo's little speaker?  Come on!  Voice command would be like, "Alexa, play some country music on the Fire TV" or "Alexa, tell the Fire TV to play some country music".  Personally, I think they should enable "Alexa tell the..." because then you can use that voice command structure with any smart device in your home...like "Alexa, tell the Harmony to turn up the volume" <--see areas for improvement #1
label: Positive

Review: 3) The artificial intelligence could learn more natural language, so that no matter how you phrase your command, it will understand it.  This already frustrates my wife because she has not yet figured out the precise language to use to get Alexa to do things.
label: Positive

Review: I bought the Echo for my 83 year old Mother. What a mistake. Maybe some day the unit with have some usable functionality for seniors but for now its just a parlor trick. The software is designed by 25 year olds for 25 year olds. Wow it can turn off a light!  Yippee!! $300 later you can now turn off the lights. Wow. What a time saver!  Can it do anything useful like dial a phone or answer a phone or read a book to you slowly? Not reliably, not easily, and not inexpensively. How about basic music and news?  Sure if you want to pay for music or spend days navigating the Amazon jungle searching for just the right way to finagle they music systems.... yes, there are NO instructions. No local news to be found. So the answer is ....not so much. Not worth much. Real PAIN ON THE  .... I wonder. How many hundreds of dollars will it take to turn on the TV? How complex will the intructions be to install it ... or more importantly how many years will it take for my Mom to learn the sequences to perform basic tasks? The commercial on TV. No. its not like that. Its clumsy and sloppy and does not work unless your diction is perfect and you speak clearly and remember the exact sequence of proper words. Yeah like my Mom can do that. She's freaking 83.  Heaven forbid it will tune to the right channel. So far its been entertaining and not much else... we have successfully avoided paying Jeff Bozo $400-500 to subscribe to the Amazon book/music club .... that the local library provides for free and a music library that we already own ..... because Mom is a billionaire and does not live on a fixed income.  So the good part is that its kept Mom out of trouble and she enjoyed it. It rarely gets any questions correct either .... unless you structure your question perfectly. And the games like Jeopardy? Waste of time. Complete waste of time ..... so thats why it has three stars instead of one.  If you think for one second that this GREAT technology is going to live up to its potential and provide any assistance for elderly parents. FORGET IT.  It made FOR kids BY kids.  They have no clue what seniors can or can not do, how they manage with limited hearing and eyesight. It could be really wonderful for hundreds of thousands of elderly adults.... but now its just a toy for children. Thats where the profit is so thats what it does. It makes money for Amazon so I guess its a success. Otherwise its only a gimmick for ten year olds that will soon wear off even for them.  Save your money and wait for another vendor to provide some products for elder adults.
label: Positive

Review: Surprising good sound for medium to large room. Voice response consistently good, had to reboot the Echo a couple of times when it would not respond to commands.  Haven't tried a lot of the functions as yet, mostly basic service Prime music.  Good selection of "stations" and artists, but some quirks--like "best of" artist includes a bunch of Xmas music, many artist's selections do not include all of their hits. (You can pay $8/month for full music service which I assume offers more selections). A lot of artists not really represented on basic service. Listen to 70's rock a lot and there is a lot of repetition if on for several hours (Sirius Radio has better playlist). This is not a service/product for true audiophile but a nice "toy" at a good price for small households, and/or select rooms. Easy set-up, simple, unobtrusive design, functional and fun.

Review: I love my Amazon echo. We got ours this past Christmas and then added a couple dots. It's sort of like potato chips, you can't have just one. Actually one would've been just fine but I like having the extra coverage. I use it every day for all sorts of things including playing trivia games to music, to turning my space heater on at night so I don't have to get up out of bed, ( this does require an additional purchase of a special plug),  to spell a word or give a definition of a word, to get the news and the weather to add things to a shopping list. That one is really convenient. Anytime you happen to think of something you can just call out please add this to the shopping list and you don't have to write it down. I also use it for alarms and timers. And then there are the fun things like when you say good morning she gives you an interesting fact about the day or something. Don't forget jokes, she tells jokes. So I definitely got my moneys worth. I will say that my spouse tends to use it only for music and timers and doesn't do as much with it as I do, but she wouldn't trade it for anything either.

label: Negative

Review: 1) I didn't realize that it didn't have a internal battery; so it wasn't portable. (this was my fault for not researching more before buying)
label: Positive

Review: 2) It would often ignore my commands. It recognized that I was talking to it, but after I gave my command, it wouldn't do anything at all. It didn't even confirm that I requested something it couldn't do. It was silent. This would happen several times a day, and the only way I could get it to respond to me was to get up and physically press the listen button on the device.
label: Positive

Review: 3) It wasn't intelligent enough to understand how to do many of the commands I gave. I asked several simple things, that I would have excpected this device to be able to handle, but unfortunately, those features aren't supported yet. This is a fairly new product and they have a long way to go. But in time, I believe it worth the money.
label: Positive

Review: Alexa doesn't know about a bird named an oriole, only the team. It can't tell me in what play Mark Ruffalo is currently starring. Or who is the king of the Greek gods. Or a ship named Ironsides. Or the captain of Moby Dick. Or, asked about Jane Eyre, it responds "the character in Jane Eyre." And so on and on...and on. I thought if I held back from being an early adopter, the knowledge base would be a little more robust. It is most assuredly not robust.
label: Positive

Review: If I could return this waste of money I would.  It is just another form of ordering Amazon products - forget the voice recognition features - Alexa cannot understand simple English words, commands, often screwing up basic functions I bought this device for.  And for recognizing music names - she is horrible. Often say one thing and she does another - will stop playing a favorite song or will just order some product. She is more an Amazon cash register than anything.  Other than setup commands from Amazon's TV commercials or simple ones (weather, traffic) she performs a 2 on a scale of 1-10. Horrible product, disappointing for a company that usually makes great items.  The whole get in the bed with Amazon for everything is a little much, and failed miserably.  I own a G Home device and am so much happier.
label: Positive

Review: Updated. After a highly critical review of the Alexa, I went to "my Account" to find the Dot that I'd recently purchased so that I could blast that as well.  While there I stumbled upon the solution. My issue was the Shopping List function -- probably the most 'productive' function apparent inability to quickly and easily clear the shopping list. Neither the Alexa App (iOS) and PC browser (alexa.amazon.com) are to display a Select All in order to then delete all.  Without this, clearing a shopping list (of say 50 items) required nearly 60 clicks or taps.  I spoke with Amazon Customer Service and they 'confirmed' that the instructions were wrong and that the function was missing.  It *is* missing from the App and the Alexa.amazon.com web site, but logging onto your amazon account, the Drop-down (Accounts & Lists) offers a Shopping List with the missing Select All.

Review: I received Alexa for Christmas, 2016.  I have been using is for 3 months now.  Alexa is helpful with precise questions an/or demands. Amazon did say that she would "learn" your area by questions and commands you do. To this date she has not been too good at building on her knowledge of the area I live.  She will tell you the weather, temp, rain forecast, play radio stations you request, and look up phone numbers for local businesses if you ask her precisely the name.  She will not look up random businesses ie Alexa, look up pet stores in my area".  She will tell you she does not understand the question. I like the apps you can download to play soothing sleep sounds and more. She will do a lot more but basically what you have seen advertised is it.  I do plan on getting the adapter for the lights etc. For the price I would definitely recommend purchasing.

Most of the time I have to put my radio on to get the program I desire, as it says it has found the program, but it broadcasts an entirely different program.  Extremely frustrating...especially if you are right in the middle of listening to an interview and it starts playing a music station!  You can repeatedly request that it play the program, and it continues to bring up a channel that is playing music.

Review: I took the chance and purchased one of these Echo unit while on Black Friday sale.  I must say I am very impressed with this little unit. And each request for music has been spot on.
label: Negative

Review: A little about the unit itself.  The unit is very well built.  I weighs about 5 pounds.  I purchased a black one and the color coating shows no signs of inconsistency.  The volume ring is easy to turn but has that friction feel that comes in very expensive audio amplifiers.  Note: you can also ask Alexa to reduce the volume if you like.  The power cord connects inside the recessed bottom.  There is an opening allowing the cord to exit the base so the unit sits flat, but you cannot see where the power plugs in.  One of things I found nice is the lights used to show you whether Alexa is hearing you.  The light is a ring around the top.  As you speak to get Alexa's attention, the light rolls around that top ring.  The light highlights which microphone has your attention.  The spoken voice used is female and pleasant.  Alexa will repeat your request and continues to present it's findings.  It is neat to watch those lights circling the top of the unit.  You can change the unit's name to Echo or Amazon.  I am not sure if you can set up any other name.  I have not really done any research in that direction other than the setup manual.
label: Positive

Review: The sound is good.  It is not like a high powered amp'd up stereo system.  But the range of sounds from base to treble can be heard with good separation.  It contains a separate "subwoofer speaker".  I would say that speaker matches the unit sound well without being overwhelming.
label: Positive

Review: Just looking through the setup possibilities, there are lot of available system programs that can be added to the unit.  You can find these in the setup program under the file titled Skills.  There are also numerous web radio stations available in case you have a favorite.  Obviously, any subscriptions through Amazon are available like Amazon Music and Audible.  And you can also listen to your Kindle offerings.

Review: I have just touched the surface of what you can do with this unit.  And from the literature I have read, 3rd party and Amazon skills are continually being added.  I have the unit connected to my home network. The skills and all other software features are stored in an Amazon Echo dedicated cloud which the unit taps when doing it's searches and completing requests.

We asked around and that's what we were told won't even work with Ethernet cable!  Had to bring it home now he only gets to use it when he's on break! So 9 months out of the year it's unusable! Real shame that Amazon hasn't addressed  the problem I've read other parents with the same complaint. I would have given it a better rating but since it's unusable for what it was intended have to give it a disappointing 2 stars.

Review: Excellent music source!! I've been looking for a good music system for my living room for quite a while now .not that I couldn't find one but it had to be right for both me and the wife..me: floor to ceiling speakers with a sub..wife: something small that she can't see ..me: a speaker in ever corner...wife: 1...that she can't see ...i needed something that could play different media iPod, SD card, CD's Internet radio , USB port..I have a very good Phillips radio that could do most of those things and had pretty good sound..but the sound was just coming from one place ..so I hooked up some external speakers and a mini sub and I was happy.." I was happy" the wife? Not so much! And I was about to add a speaker selector and expand into the dining room'...(you can just imagine her reaction!) I've been looking at the echo for a while but I thought it was limited cause my main music source is my iPod and it has no imports.....when it went on sale for black Friday for $139.00 I figure what the heck I'll give it a try...I took down everything and gave it to my youngest son ( mistake!) And waited for my echo. When it came I set it up and have been in love every since...the fact that it can stream from multiple sources prime, Pandora, ect. And I solved my iPod problem via Bluetooth transmitter (Brightech-Brightplay - Amazon $16.89) & I can upload 250 of my personal music to prime ...you can add a lot more for a price' as for the sound I think its pretty impressive for such a small speaker and the fact that it has 360' sound no matter what room I'm in I get a good listing experience.. Some reviews say its not as good as a Bose , or other high end speaker and its not.... but you don't pay $140 and get high end you get damn good! I already have a fire stick so I have a good ideal what Alexa can do...but now that I have echo I WILL be adding light switches and outlets! I've ordered a "Echo Dot" for my patio aka "man cave" where I have my "really good speakers"!and NO WIFE!

Review: 4 stars instead of 5 because of the physical design of the Echo. It's top heavy, which isn't the end of the world, but it wobbles. The base is not flat and it allows the Echo to wobble, or rock, back and forth (using the label for orientation). I sent the first one back thinking it must be flaw, but it's just the design as the second was identical. If you never touch the thing, you'd never notice, but since you can both mute and adjust the volume manually, you'll probably run into this. This make the Echo feel less than solid. It's a small thing, but it makes it feel cheap.
label: Negative

Review: I am really enjoying my Echo product. I have a friend at work that keeps asking me why do I need it when I have my phone (Siri) that essentially does the same thing. I tell him it's so much more. Much more convenient (to me) and it keeps getting better. The only way to truly justify this type of technology is to "just use it!". Even if you ask it the most inane of questions, you are using it. Great product.
label: Positive

Review: Just got my Echo today and so far I absolutely love it. The sound could be better but I stilllive it!!!
label: Positive

Review: Gets better everyday!
label: Positive

Review: This review is likely a drop in the bucket, but we do love our Amazon Echo. We use it way more often than our high quality bluetooth speakers because of the convenience of waking up "Alexa" using nothing but our words. I find myself using the Echo mostly for music (it is connected to our Pandora, Spotify and Amazon Music accounts), but also to create shopping lists, get the weather, track traffic and even do basic arithmetic. We have recommended it to our friends and purchased an additional one as a gift.
label: Positive

Review: It's sort of fun.  But not really a necessity for me.  There are some nice features which you can read elsewhere, but my phone does most of the things Alexa does already.  It really is just a toy.
label: Positive
